BasicIO

Class ASCIIPrompter

  • java.lang.Object
    • BasicIO.ASCIIPrompter

  • public class ASCIIPrompter
extends java.lang.Object
    ASCIIPrompter is used as a quick way to get text input from the user. It presents a form with a labeled (prompted) text field. It simulates input from a text file, working the same way that ASCIIDataFile does. When a read is performed, the ASCIIPrompter will become visible, the user enters text into the provided field and presses OK and the ASCIIPrompter converts the field into the desired format and returns the value. Pressing End instead of OK simulates EOF (End of File). A read operation can fail (successful returns false) if either the text cannot be interpreted as the desired type (isDataError returns true) or if the user pressed End (simulating EOF, isEOF returns true).
    Version:
    1.0 July 2008
    Author:
    Andrew Cheesman

    • Constructor Detail

      • ASCIIPrompter

        public ASCIIPrompter()
        Creates a form with a labeled text field to prompt the user for text input. There are two buttons, OK and End, OK indicates the input should be accepted and End indicates the input should not be accepted, simulating end of file (EOF). No log file is created.

      • ASCIIPrompter

        public ASCIIPrompter(boolean logIt)
        Creates a form with a labeled text field to prompt the user for text input. There are two buttons, OK and End, OK indicates the input should be accepted and End indicates the input should not be accepted, simulating end of file (EOF). If the parameter is true a file will be created to log all input done via this prompter, otherwise no log file is created.
        Parameters:
        logIt - whether a log file should be created

    • Method Detail

      • successful

        public boolean successful()
        This method returns true if the last opperation was successful, false otherwise. isDataError and isEOF may be called to determine why the last operation may have failed.
        Returns:
        true if last opperation was successful, false otherwise.

      • isDataEror

        public boolean isDataEror()
        This method returns true if the last operation failed due to a data error. An example of a data error would be from reading an int value when the characters "hello world" were enetered which may not be interpreted as a int.
        Returns:
        true if last operation failed due to a data error, false otherwise.

      • isEOF

        public boolean isEOF()
        This method returns true if the last operation failed due to an end of file simulated by the user pressing End.
        Returns:
        true if last operation failed due to an end of file, false otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the ASCIIPrompter and frees resources. The ASCIIPrompter should not be used thereafter.

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Changes the text of the label (prompt) on the form.
        Parameters:
        label - The text to be displayed in the label
